display
Class DisplayGraphics

java.lang.Object
  display.DisplayGraphics

public class DisplayGraphics
extends Object

used to handle basic interface with the graphic/drawing components of the main display

Version:
March 19, 2012
Author:
jkidney

Constructor Summary

          Basic constructor
 
Method Summary
 void buildMap(int rows, int cols)
          Builds the basic map on the display, all caves are set to empty to start
 void buildMap(int rows, int cols, Color[][] caveColors)
          Builds the basic map on the display Null at any location in caveColors indicates that no color should be drawn at that location

          Clears the background on the main display

          Clears the foreground on the main display

          Updates the drawn map based upon the current state of the cave Color settings in the map

Method Detail

buildMap

public void buildMap(int rows,
                     int cols)
Builds the basic map on the display, all caves are set to empty to start

Parameters:
rows - the number of rows in the map
cols - the number of columns in the map

buildMap

public void buildMap(int rows,
                     int cols,
                     Color[][] caveColors)
Builds the basic map on the display Null at any location in caveColors indicates that no color should be drawn at that location

Parameters:
rows - the number of rows in the map
cols - the number of columns in the map
caveColors - 2d array of java.awt.Color objects that represent the cave colors

clearMainBackGround

public void clearMainBackGround()
Clears the background on the main display

clearMainForeGround

public void clearMainForeGround()
Clears the foreground on the main display

clearStoryDisplay

public void clearStoryDisplay()
Clears both the background and the foreground on the main display

drawImageInBackground

public void drawImageInBackground(int x,
                                  int y,
                                  DisplayImage img)
                           throws RuntimeException
Draws the image in the background. It will start to draw the image from the given starting point for the top left hand corner of the image

Parameters:
x - the starting x point to draw the image from ( top left corner )
y - the starting y point to draw the image from ( top left corner )
img - the image to display
Throws:
RuntimeException

drawImageInForeground

public void drawImageInForeground(int x,
                                  int y,
                                  DisplayImage img)
                           throws RuntimeException
Draws the image in the foreground. It will start to draw the image from the given starting point for the top left hand corner of the image

Parameters:
x - the starting x point to draw the image from ( top left corner )
y - the starting y point to draw the image from ( top left corner )
img - the image to display
Throws:
RuntimeException

getStoryDisplayDimensions

public Dimension getStoryDisplayDimensions()
returns the size of the story display area for drawing graphics @see Dimension

Returns:
a Dimension object

setCaveColorAt

public void setCaveColorAt(int row,
                           int col,
                           Color c)
Sets the color for a cave in the map. Can be null to indicate the cave should not be drawn

Parameters:
row - the row location of the cave
col - the column location of the cave
c - the color to set the cave to

setUserLocation

public void setUserLocation(int row,
                            int col)
Sets the current location of the user in the map

Parameters:
row - the current row location
col - the current column location of the user

updateDrawnMap

public void updateDrawnMap()
Updates the drawn map based upon the current state of the cave Color settings in the map
